title: Report: Patriots owner Robert Kraft not selected for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft was not selected for the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class, needing 40 votes out of 50.
Kraft and Bill Belichick, both first-time finalists, were not selected among five candidates for the Hall of Fame.
Kraft, owning Patriots since 1994, has overseen six Super Bowl wins, needing one more win to tie Packers for playoff victories.

title: Forget the refs. Bruins only have themselves to blame after collapse in Tampa.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins lost to Tampa Bay Lightning 6-5 in a shootout during the Stadium Series game at Raymond James Stadium.
Despite leading 5-1, Bruins' poor discipline and penalties allowed Lightning to tie the game and win in a shootout.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasized the need for Bruins to manage penalties better to succeed in the upcoming season games.

title: How NFL commissioner Roger Goodell reacted to reported Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell denied responsibility for Bill Belichick's Pro Football Hall of Fame voting outcome.
Belichick did not receive the required 80% of votes to be inducted into this year's Hall of Fame class.
Goodell emphasized the NFL's lack of control over the Hall of Fame voting, despite being on its board.

title: North Andover’s Jake Bobo ready to play ‘bad guy’ against hometown Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jake Bobo, a Seattle Seahawks wide receiver, is eager to play against his hometown New England Patriots in the Super Bowl.
Bobo, a North Andover native, enjoyed multiple Patriots Super Bowl parades but now aims to prevent another for his hometown.
Despite reduced playtime this season, Bobo seeks to make a significant contribution in the upcoming Super Bowl matchup.

title: 10 Patriots takeaways from Super Bowl Opening Night
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye assures fans he's fit for Super Bowl LX despite recent injury concerns and illness.
Patriots players credit head coach Mike Vrabel for team's successful season leading to Super Bowl.
New England Patriots embrace underdog status against 4.5-point favorite Seattle Seahawks in upcoming game.

title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, is charged with assault, kidnapping, and unauthorized medical practice after performing unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston.
Wang allegedly caused permanent damage by injecting non-FDA-approved fillers and forcibly completing surgery on a 22-year-old victim.
She faces charges of larceny and misrepresenting herself for loans, and is set to be arraigned on February 5.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda was hit by an MBTA train in Abington after breaking down on tracks near Plymouth St.
The car's 35-year-old driver exited the vehicle before it was struck; there were no injuries reported.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. on Sunday, according to Transit Police.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman was fatally struck by a car on Route 28 in Wareham due to snow-covered sidewalks.
The accident occurred Sunday night, with the woman walking alongside a man using a walker on the highway.
Police reported no distraction or speeding by the Volvo driver; investigation into the incident is ongoing.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to 4 years in prison for child pornography charges.
Aiello, 37, pleaded guilty in October to receiving child pornography, stored on an encrypted USB drive.
Police found over 200 files of abuse material and identified Aiello as a registered user of a pornography site.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The U.S. Coast Guard confirmed the deaths of seven people in the Lily Jean fishing boat sinking off Gloucester.
State Sen. Bruce Tarr highlighted the community's mourning and praised the fallen crew as the 'finest kind.'
The Coast Guard and NTSB will conduct an investigation into the incident, which could take several months.
